title: [PLAN 10.10] FCP-Inspired Hardening + Interop Integration Track
description:
Section: 10.10 â€” FCP-Inspired Hardening + Interop Integration Track

Strategic Context:
FCP-inspired hardening/interop contract for IDs, serialization, control-channel auth, revocation freshness, and publication gating.

Execution Requirements:
- Preserve all scoped capabilities from the canonical plan.
- Keep contracts self-contained so future contributors can execute without reopening the master plan.
- Require explicit testing strategy (unit + integration/e2e) and structured logging/telemetry for every child bead.
- Require artifact-backed validation for performance, security, and correctness claims.

Dependency Semantics:
- This epic is blocked by its child implementation beads.
- Cross-epic dependencies encode strategic sequencing and canonical ownership boundaries.

## Success Criteria
- All child beads for this section are completed with acceptance artifacts attached and no unresolved blockers.
- Section-level verification gate for comprehensive unit tests, integration/e2e workflows, and detailed structured logging evidence is green.
- Scope-to-plan traceability is explicit, with no feature loss versus the canonical plan section.

## Optimization Notes
- User-Outcome Lens: "[PLAN 10.10] FCP-Inspired Hardening + Interop Integration Track" must improve operator confidence, safety posture, and deterministic recovery behavior under both normal and adversarial conditions.
- Cross-Section Coordination: child beads must encode integration assumptions explicitly to avoid local optimizations that degrade system-wide correctness.
- Verification Non-Negotiable: completion requires reproducible unit/integration/E2E evidence and structured logs suitable for independent replay.
- Scope Protection: any simplification must preserve canonical-plan feature intent and be justified with explicit tradeoff documentation.
notes: Claimed ready open integration epic; validating closed child set + section gate and producing closure evidence
close_reason: Section 10.10 integration epic closure criteria met (all dependencies closed; gate bd-1jjq PASS; artifacts present)

dependencies.title: [10.10] Adopt canonical trust protocol vectors/golden fixtures (from `10.13` + `10.14`) as product publication and release gates.
[10.10] Adopt canonical stable error namespace and compatibility policy (from `10.13`) across product surfaces.
[10.10] Integrate canonical revocation freshness semantics (from `10.13`) before risky and dangerous product actions.
[10.10] Integrate canonical session-authenticated control channel + monotonic anti-replay framing (from `10.13`) across product control APIs.
[10.10] Implement key-role separation for control-plane signing/encryption/issuance.
[10.10] Implement audience-bound token chains for control actions.
[10.10] Implement rollback/fork detection in control-plane state propagation using canonical divergence and marker proofs (from `10.14`).
[10.10] Implement policy checkpoint chain for product release channels.
[10.10] Enforce product-level adoption of canonical deterministic serialization and signature preimage rules (from `10.13` + `10.14`).
[10.10] Define canonical product trust object IDs with domain separation.
